data.title: [RA] Visual, Polish/Performance and Balance Tweak for the next Playtest
data.body:
This is the soft end on a list of changes played out on balance playtest maps: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=20017

With few exceptions this list focus on neutral game elements that seek to improve overall game play experience. With the Hit-Shape and Unit Stance features coming up I've held off changes that alters units and structures in relation to performance and damage vs buildings and defensive structures. Changes that crosses the effect of the HitShape/UnitStance of the upcoming official playtest ought to be held off until we're satisfied and familiar with how they work.

Most of these changes are in fact inspired from Fortnight's Overhaul mod (http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=299841) that sought to improve the game in various ways. As a whole his mod was straying a bit too far off the deep end but with it came an endless amount of changes that brings new and interesting solutions to problems you didn't really notice.

- - - - - - - -

VISUAL:

- MiG/YAK - Simplified unit names in UI ***removed**
- Longbow - SHP fix
- Chinook - SHP fix
- Parabombs - Remove shadows

The full names MiG/Yak Attack Plane is a bit unnecessary and looks noisy in the UI in-game when attempting to hover over a moving unit. The [SHP fixes](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=299841#299841) has done a great job removing visible smudges on the units.

Parabomb shadows was turned on :True through a [recent commit](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13522/commits/78de7c2294c7147277b22a19fec2c5a8a43f0bcc) and I take it was to fix a glitch overlooked by #12737 however the PR left it :False deliberately because it just didn't look very good. The parabomb shadow, although physically correct, "dances" on spot until the projectile hit and takes away from the experience of watching the drop demolish its targets.

- - - - - - - -

PERFORMANCE/DESIGN:

- ^Helicopter - WaitDistanceFromResupplyBase: 4c0, up from 3c0
- Havester - Ore (From Order), 11, down from 15
- Silo - Stores 3k - Build Adjacency: 4c0, up from 2c0
- Kennel - Build adjacency: 4c0, up from 2c0
- Service Depot - 30% faster repair speed, add traversable cells
- War Factory, Soviet Tech Center, Sub Pen, Naval Yard - vision range: 5c0, up from 4c0
- Unify cloak detection range on all defensive structures - range: 6c0 (Turret -1, Tesla Coil -2)

These are all aims to smooth out the game experience in various ways. Less cloggy helicopters, harvesters that sticks more to its designated ore patch and Silos and Kennels that can be placed a bit off base so as not to obstruct general base planning and crawling. The Silo storage capacity increase actually made the structure borderline useful. Service depot with traversable cells top/bottom looked decent enough and supports better unit movement in base.

The change with vision range and cloak detection range is part of a move to streamline the game design a bit. With exception to cheap structures such as Power Plants and Silos there's no apparent reason why the War Factory and Soviet Tech Center has a vision range of 4c0 while Barracks and Service Depot has a vision range of 5c0. As for cloak detection, one important factor in using cloaked units is to be able to plan routes and estimate risks around detection. Different ranged cloak detection on defensive structures kind of discourages the attempt as players can't get a good feel of how to traverse around enemy bases safely. These are pretty minor but if nothing else it would smoothen out the game design aspect in which players can better anticipate certain behaviors from the game.

- - - - - - - - -

GAME BALANCING:

- Dog - HP: 18, up from 12
- +1c0 vision range for Medium, Heavy and Mammoth Tank
- Power-down/low-power reduces vision range down to 5c0 from 10c0 on Radar Dome, Iron Curtain and Chronosphere.
- Camo. Pillbox – cost $700, down from $800 - HP 400, down from 450
- Walls/Sandbag/Fence - No longer gives experience.
- Hospital – vision range 4, up from 3 - HP 800, down from 1000
- Oil Derrick - vision range 4, up from 3 - HP 800, down from 1000
- Civilian/Technician – vision range 3, up from 2.

The dogs HP change doesn't take into account #13513 but as that PR aims for the next release I'd love to include this change in the playtest. Despite being bugged the tiny HP increase has extended the use of the dog, especially by players using it as scouts. Basically it can absorb one hit from the rifleman making it win 1v1 engagements and provides a window of escape when passing the edge of the rifleman's vision range.

+1 vision range for the main battle tanks promotes better army retention, meaning players are better equipped to decide wether or not to engage with their units supported by tanks. In practice this allowed players to use their armies more towards grandstanding and map control as opposed to go in blind when the enemy is detected. In turn players felt a bit more comfortable teching up behind their Service Depot army.

The Camo.Pillbox Price/HP change - having equal HP as the regular Pillbox makes memorization and intuitive action by players better. The downscaling of the price reduction vs HP reduction is fairly similar.

The 1000 HP on the Oil Derrics and Hospitals has always felt just a little too much tanky and time consuming to kill off. 800 HP felt more sensible and the +1c0 vision enabled the structures to function better as strategic points in addition to their perks.

The Technician vision range 2c0 simply looks bad in-game and with 3c0 can actually be used as map spotters.

- - - - - - -

Overall these won't really change game balancing all too much but will most definitely level up the game experience for the playerbase. As initially stated game balancing beyond the official playtest ought to be brought onboard after its release as the HitShape/UnitStance risk making previous game balance alterations moot. This might feel like a step back in the ongoing game balancing process for RA but it seems to me if the official playtest turns out to be successful the rewards can outweigh the hurdles many times over.

data.title: Add more RevealDisguiseOn types and unhardcode some events
data.body: Events means things like `Infiltration`, `Demolition` and `Unloading`. That was hardcoded to only uncloak units before, but now calls an interface which can be easily implemented by custom traits.

data.title: Make aircraft takeoff after creation/resupply optional
data.body: Modders shouldn't be forced to hack around in Mods.Common just to replicate the original games' behaviour.

data.title: Editor actor categories style fixes
data.body: Not sure whether the missing `:` might even break something, but in any case, I think this should be merged before the playtest. Discovered while testing upgrade rules.

data.title: TD Airstrike Balance.
data.body:
This has been a tough decision. I have nerfed the napalm damage from 65 to 35 commited by reaperrr since at 65 they were still one shotting weapon factories and airstrips. The problem however was that it still did way to much damage to the airstrip. Sometimes even killing it in one strike. This also affected refineries coming in at certain angles. Bringing the Vulcan down from 25 to 15 wood damage helps to keep it alive a majority of the time. (Still brings it to red at times.) Problem now is the airstrike is now a unit killing role rather then killing power plants and various other structures. (Doesn't exactly kill barracks/helipads everytime anymore.)

Im not exactly sure what to do. The hitboxes has been doing very well with the exception of this one. For the time being the airstrike will play its role as a unit killer rather then its role to kill structures of certain types. I would strongly prefer this then having them one shotting weapon factories/airstrips.

Shortened:

Airstrike Napalm vs wood from 65 to 35.
Airstrike Vulcan vs wood from 25 to 15.

data.title: Replace Mobile.OnRails hack with dedicated OnRails traits
data.body:
While the new `OnRails` and `AttackOnRailsTurreted` are essentially hacky as well,
- they don't meddle with Common code (literally)
- they work better, because on bleed the gunboat often stops for a few ticks when attacking, while with this PR it works just like in the original game
- they allow to remove waypoints and lua triggers from some TD missions

Additionally, used this opportunity to replace the hacky camera actors in those missions with adjusted `RevealsShroud.ValidStances`.

data.title: Upgrading maps broken again
data.body:
Probably as result of recent Zip refactors.
![map-upgr-error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2857877/28195062-58299504-6848-11e7-8eb7-5cc7df130c67.png)

data.title: Fix Windows desktop icons being installed for all users.
data.body:
Fixes a regression from #12764:

> upon uninstall, it didn't remove the launcher icons from desktop (on Windows).

The `SetShellVarContext` remained set to `all` when writing the desktop icons, which generated them in the "all users" directory.  We then tried to remove them from the local profile on uninstall, which fails because they aren't there.

data.title: Walls (LineBuild) show buildable building overlay for unbuildable terrain in adjacent range
data.body:
I was testing stuff for my code about #10550 and noticed that on D2K, first thought it was something with my code, but it happens on bleed too. It just shows wrong overlay, clicking there still gives "Cannot Build Here" notification as should be. ~I only tested on D2K, but other mods should be effected too~. Edit: Yes happens on RA too. It shows unbuildable overlay as it should be for furter places from its `Adjacent:`

Not sure when this regressed, but #13025 is best candidate i can see.

Edit: Image
![adsiz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7933210/28182361-408e554c-680c-11e7-87d5-6a2959077770.png)

data.title: Harvester ResourceClaim then ride on transport to prevent ally mining
data.body:
Not so common case. If a harvester makes a resource claim before riding onto transports, then ally harvesters will not be able to mine the claimed cell until the transport gets killed or the harvester makes a new claim.

This can be fixed by having IsInWorld check in IsClaimedByAnyoneElse but then it would break D2K Carryall. Discussion here:

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13607

data.title: Playing an in game video,will crash spectators game during replay.
data.body:
Prof of bug
http://resource.openra.net/maps/21800/

Note*
add full number of bots during test of the bug on this map,otherwise lua will crash.

data.title: Let the user define what "rules.yaml" he wants in lobby
data.body: it would be nice to let the user define what "rules.yaml" he want from a list of "rules.yaml" shipped with a map, that will allow him to pick completely different types of gameplay on same map. something like a drop down menu with a list of rules added by the map author on the map.

data.title: Allow turning Missile terrain height checks off
data.body:
And do so by default.

At second glance this was easier than expected, by just preventing all height-related helpers from triggering if `!TerrainHeightAware`.
Couldn't spot any regressions so far.

Closes #13616.

Debug builds on my system (Win7x64, i5-2500 @ 3.2GHz) show ~0.015ms savings per Dragon missile in RA.

data.title: Fix RotationPaletteEffect not working with player palettes
data.body: Closes #13626.

data.title: Water pixel rotation is broken on RA naval actors
data.body: Dunno since when exactly, but it's already been like this on last release.

data.title: Modding guide does not contain the Linux path
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Modding-Guide

"Each mod has a directory inside the mods directory in the game root. It is the name of this directory which is used when naming mods to load. Everything related to a particular mod is contained within this directory (with the possible exception of user maps, which can be loaded from other locations too.)"

Where is the `mods` directory? On Windows this is located at `C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA\mods` but the wiki doesn't say where it is on Linux. It doesn't appear to be in `~/.openra`.

data.title: Add support for Generals Pilot Logic
data.body:
Pretty much a copy-paste from DeliversCash stuff. Entering actor gives the levels it has to target. ~~For testcase i gave E1 pilot ability.~~

~~Edit: What Travis isn't happy about is something to do with testcase/mission maps so you can ignore it.~~

data.title: Fix black tile on template 438 of RA desert tileset
data.body: Fixes #13586.

data.title: Audio device names is now shown correctly in the Audio Device combolist.
data.body: Ignored DA version of resource dll.

data.title: Fix infantry staying out of range
data.body: Closes #5841.

data.title: Add uninterruptability support to sprite turret anims and fix trait namings
data.body:
The goal of this PR is to make the addition of more turret animation traits less of a hassle.

- All animations being overridable by other anims would easily cause issues once more animation types are added (turret move anim, turret charge etc.), so I added support for making them uninterruptible.
- With*Turreted*AttackAnimation could easily be misinterpreted by modders to modify 'With*Turreted*SpriteBody', which is wrong, so I gave the latter a less ambigous name. 
- 'Turret*ed*' was also not in line with our implicit render trait naming convention (affects both traits mentioned), so I adressed that as well.
- Moved the renamed `WithEmbeddedTurretSpriteBody` to Mods.Cnc, since only gun turrets, sam sites and flak cannon in TD/RA use it in our official mods.

data.title: DeliversExperience/AcceptsDeliveredExperience (Generals Pilot Logic)
data.body:
While answering http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=20191&start=0&postdays=0&postorder=asc&highlight= i realised Generals Pilot logic is pretty similar to what we have for Supply Trucks. Unit enters another unit, but instead of cash, it gives XP. So it sounds easy to implement to me.

I'll take a look to that when i back home this Wednesday.

data.title: "Mods" menu item is missing when building from bleed
data.body:
I have probably missed something. I tried to look around for any clues but to no avail.

When I start the game downloaded from http://www.openra.net/download/
I have a "Mods" menu item in the main menu, from there I can switch between the different game types.

But in my version I have compiled myself I must provide which gametype I want to play.
for examle "OpenRA.Game.exe Game.Mod=ra"

Failing to provide Game.Mod option the game just crashes.

And the "Mods" menu item is missing when starting RA for example.

data.title: Either add simpler LegacyMissile or refactor Missile
data.body:
As @pchote pointed out on IRC, a missile projectile without all the height-map-aware calculations would perform significantly better.

One option might have been to restore the old, pre-refactor `Missile`, however it was vastly inferior in visuals and realism due to its "move to target altitude as quickly as possible" behaviour, which made it fly at ground level when targeting ground targets.

To adress the former without re-introducing the latter, I've instead taken bleed's `Missile` and stripped it of (hopefully all) heightmap-related calculations, while trying to preserve the flight and targeting behaviour on flat terrain.

According to my tests, this nearly cuts CPU cycles per missile in half.
This could help performance in all 3 legacy mods, now the question is, do we want 
- a) an additional `LegacyMissile` or `2DTerrainMissile` projectile? (then I could file a PR with mine)
- b) a `DisableTerrainAwareness` bool on `Missile`? (too complicated to implement for me, this would have to be done by someone else)
- c) neither? (leave it to 3rd-party mods to share and use simpler missile projectiles, leave bleed's `Missile` untouched for now)

data.title: Where's the exception on modded maps
data.body: when people aren't interested in making community mods or are just testing stuff out via the safety-net of mod maps, they shouldn't have to feel alienated with the fact they can't be given exception logs when their maps aren't compatible with the version of the mod they're running. if OpenRA knows what is wrong, why is it not distributing it's fine knowledge onto the person making mod maps to allow them to figure out what is wrong?

data.title: Bridge repair appears through fog of war
data.body: Opponents are able to see bridge repairs when map is explored despite not actively scouting the bridge.  This thwarts any surprise attacks bridge users might have and affects naval maps with bridge mechanics in play.

data.title: Throw a FileNotFoundException if source zip file isn't found.
data.body: Followup to #13559.  The expected behaviour when trying to open (not create) a missing file is to throw a FileNotFound exception.

data.title: Mod template packaging tweaks
Move code style checking to its own executable.
data.body:
Depends on and followup to #13602.  This moves the code-style checks from the utility to its own dedicated executable so that we can remove the Stylecop dependency from Mods.Common.

OpenRA.StyleCheck.exe is licensed under MS-PL to resolve the issues with GPL vs MS-PL compatibility.
